---
title: "Analysis of Environmental Movement's Effectiveness"
subtitle: "INFO 526 - Summer 2024 - Final Project"
author: "Cole Johnson"
title-slide-attributes:
  data-background-image: images/watercolour_sys02_img34_teacup-ocean.jpg
  data-background-size: stretch
  data-background-opacity: "0.7"
  data-slide-number: none
format:
  revealjs:
    theme:  ['data/customtheming.scss']
  
editor: visual
execute:
  echo: false
---








## Introduction

The dataset that is being investigated presents information regarding the amount of pollutants removed from rivers by trashwheels, which are devices located at the end of rivers which remove trash. Alongside this dataset, I included data regarding when the most prominent environmental movements took place over the last decade. By analysing visualizations made from these two datasets we will clearly see the effectiveness that environmental movements have on reducing pollutants and transfering pollutants from non recyclables to recyclables.

## Question 1: How are environmental movements affecting the Trash Wheels collections located that the end of rivers?

## Motivation for Question 1:

-Through analysis of trends created by differing quantities of pollutants being removed by trash wheels alongside the timing of environmental movements, we will be able to determine if environmental movements actually benefit the quantities or types of pollutants being put into rivers.

## General Quantity of Pollutants Removed by Trash Wheels from Rivers

::: {.cell-output-display}

## Environmental Movement's Impact on Recyclables versus Non-Recyclables


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](presentation_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=1800}
:::
:::



## Insights Gained From the Visualizations

-Steady Trend of pollutants moving from recyclables to non-recyclables.

  -Environmental Movements are at least helping create more recyclables.
  
-Greta Thunberg's school strike movement helped lower quantities of pollutants in rivers

-First National CleanUp Day seemed to actually negativly affect the quantity of recyclables versus non-recyclables.

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
